duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinates and oversees all direct care patient services provided by clinical personnel.
Develops, plans, implements, and organizes clinical operations for a specific location managed.

Conducts/delegates the assessment and reassessment of patients, including updating of care plans and interpreting patient needs, while adhering to Company, physician, and/or health facility procedures/policies.
Manages the assignment of caregivers and oversees the delivery of care to all patients served by the location.
Reviews available patient information related to the case to determine home health or hospice needs and makes the decision to admit patients to service.
Instructs and guides clinicians to promote more effective performance and delivery of quality home care services.
Assists clinicians in establishing immediate and long-term therapeutic goals, setting priorities, and developing patient Plans of Care.
Monitors cases to ensure documentation is in compliance with regulatory agencies and requirements of third-party payers.
Coordinates communication between team members/attending physicians/caregivers to ensure the appropriateness of care and outcome planning.
Works in conjunction with the Branch Director and Company Finance Department to establish location’s revenue and budget goals.
Participates in sales and marketing initiatives.

Supervises all clinical employees assigned to a specific location, handles employee corrective action and discipline issues, and participates in the interviewing, hiring, training, and development of direct care clinicians.
Analyzes situations, evaluates alternative courses of action, and reviews appropriate clinical staff documentation for appropriateness.
Responsible for QA/PI activities, data tracking for performance review, and outcomes of care analysis.

Provides interpretation of knowledge and direction to staff, maintains relationships with referral/community sources, and participates in professional organizations and conducts care-related programs.
Performs other related duties as assigned or requested.
Provides direct patient care on an infrequent basis and only in times of emergency.
Acts as Branch Director in his/her absence and ensures compliance with external regulatory authorities.
Participates in performance improvement activities and maintains ongoing clinical knowledge through internal and external training programs.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an accredited School of Nursing.
Current state license as a Registered Nurse.
Valid driver’s license, auto insurance, and reliable transportation.
Two years as a Registered Nurse with at least one-year of management experience in a home care, hospice, or equivalent environment.
